text: Thanks for sending that over, I'm definitely interested in some aspects of the role. My school runs work experience from the 6th-17th July 2020. I need to find a placement asap. I want this placement to be in something I would like to work in, in the future. Also, I need to gain as many transferable skills to help with my apprenticeship applications from the end of next year. HR would be a good opportunity for me to see how the business works. I would like to get a placement in a creative sector employer. Do you think Framestore London would offer someone like myself a work experience placement?
I’m also going to start working on my CV today, would you mind looking over it and making any suggestions once I’ve done it.

How long is the placement for? I think Framestore London does 1 day observation internships. I can definitely ask more info on that. Is that the same thing? 
I’m sorry, I lack knowledge on the UK system! 
Of course send me your CV when it’s ready. I’m very impressed you’re aware and conscious of transferable skills.

Don’t put too much pressure on yourself if the internship isn’t exactly what you had hoped for. Mine was a week long when I was 15 and was in a company that rents material for shows lighting. I wanted to work in venues and control lighting.

And my first apprentice job was in what turned out to be the worst work environment possible for me. I’m happy I experimented it though because it’s helped me figure out what I really want. All experience will bring you closer to what you really want :)
